PHAR_V 480-002 - Pharmaceutical Topics and Communication Seminar IV

detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value: This course will take place in the Pharmaceutical Sciences building, room 3340.

detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value: Register for this course if you have been approved for a 2024W2 Experiential - Research option.

detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value: Register for this course if you have been approved for a 2024W2 Experiential - Honours option.

detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes

instances.text: PHAR_V 497-B_002 - Directed Studies in Pharmaceutical Sciences (B)

detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value: This course will introduce students to contemporary philosophy of perception. Likely topics include: the nature of sensory experience; perceptual knowledge; illusion and hallucination; introspection; and asymmetries between vision and audition. Students will be assessed by a mix of (very) short papers and exams.

instances.text: PHIL_V 455-A_002 - Topics in the Philosophy of Cognitive Science (A)
PHIL_V 470-002 - Comparative Conceptions of the Self

detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value:
PHIL470 is cross-listed with ASIA470.
Course Description: This course will examine various conceptions of the self in Asian philosophical traditions. Although the class format is lecture, emphasis will be given to classroom discussion of readings.

detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value:
This seminar course is open only to Philosophy Honours students.Non-PHIL HON students enrolled in this course section will be removed.
ATTENTION Philosophy Honours Students: This honours seminar course is one of the requirements to complete your philosophy honours degree. Please ensure that you do not register in any other classes during your assigned honours seminar timeslot. If you have any concerns or encounter registration issues, please reach out to phil.undergrad@ubc.ca.

uiLabels.WDRES.FACETEDSEARCH.SymanSyntax:
Boolean logic can be expressed using AND, OR, NOT, and (). 
Exact phrases can be surrounded by double quotation marks. 
Example: ("software engineer" OR computer science) AND ~manager~.
